column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=XIX .
#Text=DR . MACBRIDE BEGS PARDON
#Text=Judge and Mrs. Henry , Molly Wood , and two strangers , a lady and a gentleman , were the party which had been driving in the large three-seated wagon .
#Text=They had seemed a merry party .

#Text=But as I came within hearing of their talk , it was a fragment of the minister 's sonority which reached me first : “ -- more opportunity for them to have the benefit of hearing frequent sermons , ” was the sentence I heard him bring to completion .
#Text=“ Yes , to be sure , sir . ”
#Text=Judge Henry gave me ( it almost seemed ) additional warmth of welcome for arriving to break up the present discourse .
#Text=“ Let me introduce you to the Rev. Dr. Alexander MacBride .
#Text=Doctor , another guest we have been hoping for about this time , ” was my host 's cordial explanation to him of me .
#Text=There remained the gentleman with his wife from New York , and to these I made my final bows .
#Text=But I had not broken up the discourse .
#Text=“ We may be said to have met already . ”
#Text=Dr. MacBride had fixed upon me his full , mastering eye ; and it occurred to me that if they had policemen in heaven , he would be at least a centurion in the force .
#Text=But he did not mean to be unpleasant ; it was only that in a mind full of matters less worldly , pleasure was left out .
#Text=“ I observed your friend was a skilful horseman , ” he continued .
#Text=“ I was saying to Judge Henry that I could wish such skilful horsemen might ride to a church upon the Sabbath .
#Text=A church , that is , of right doctrine , where they would have opportunity to hear frequent sermons . ”
#Text=“ Yes , ” said Judge Henry , “ yes .
#Text=It would be a good thing . ”
#Text=Mrs. Henry , with some murmur about the kitchen , here went into the house .
#Text=“ I was informed , ” Dr. MacBride held the rest of us , “ before undertaking my journey that I should find a desolate and mainly godless country .
#Text=But nobody gave me to understand that from Medicine Bow I was to drive three hundred miles and pass no church of any faith . ”
#Text=The Judge explained that there had been a few a long way to the right and left of him .
#Text=“ Still , ” he conceded , “ you are quite right .
#Text=But do n't forget that this is the newest part of a new world . ”
#Text=“ Judge , ” said his wife , coming to the door , “ how can you keep them standing in the dust with your talking ? ”
#Text=This most efficiently did break up the discourse .

#Text=As our little party , with the smiles and the polite holdings back of new acquaintanceship , moved into the house , the Judge detained me behind all of them long enough to whisper dolorously , “ He 's going to stay a whole week . ”
#Text=I had hopes that he would not stay a whole week when I presently learned of the crowded arrangements which our hosts , with many hospitable apologies , disclosed to us .
#Text=They were delighted to have us , but they had n't foreseen that we should all be simultaneous .
#Text=The foreman 's house had been prepared for two of us , and did we mind ?
#Text=The two of us were Dr. MacBride and myself ; and I expected him to mind .
#Text=But I wronged him grossly .
#Text=It would be much better , he assured Mrs. Henry , than straw in a stable , which he had tried several times , and was quite ready for .
#Text=So I saw that though he kept his vigorous body clean when he could , he cared nothing for it in the face of his mission .

#Text=How the foreman and his wife relished being turned out during a week for a missionary and myself was not my concern , although while he and I made ready for supper over there , it struck me as hard on them .
#Text=The room with its two cots and furniture was as nice as possible ; and we closed the door upon the adjoining room , which , however , seemed also untenanted .
#Text=Mrs. Henry gave us a meal so good that I have remembered it , and her husband the Judge strove his best that we should eat it in merriment .

#Text=He poured out his anecdotes like wine , and we should have quickly warmed to them ; but Dr. MacBride sat among us , giving occasional heavy ha-ha 's , which produced , as Miss Molly Wood whispered to me , a “ dreadfully cavernous effect . ”
#Text=Was it his sermon , we wondered , that he was thinking over ?
#Text=I told her of the copious sheaf of them I had seen him pull from his wallet over at the foreman 's .
#Text=“ Goodness ! ” said she .
#Text=“ Then are we to hear one every evening ? ”
#Text=This I doubted ; he had probably been picking one out suitable for the occasion .
#Text=“ Putting his best foot foremost , ” was her comment ; “ I suppose they have best feet , like the rest of us . ”
#Text=Then she grew delightfully sharp .
#Text=“ Do you know , when I first heard him I thought his voice was hearty .
#Text=But if you listen , you 'll find it 's merely militant .
#Text=He never really meets you with it .
#Text=He 's off on his hill watching the battle-field the whole time . ”
#Text=“ He will find a hardened pagan here . ”
#Text=“ Judge Henry ? ”
#Text=“ Oh , no !
#Text=The wild man you 're taming brought you Kenilworth safe back . ”
#Text=She was smooth .
#Text=“ Oh , as for taming him !
#Text=But do n't you find him intelligent ? ”
#Text=Suddenly I somehow knew that she did n't want to tame him .
#Text=But what did she want to do ?
#Text=The thought of her had made him blush this afternoon .
#Text=No thought of him made her blush this evening .
